data.description: About Gusto At Gusto, we're on a mission to grow the small business economy. We handle the hard stuff—like payroll, health insurance, 401(k)s, and HR—so owners can focus on their craft and customers. With teams in Denver, San Francisco, and New York, we’re proud to support more than 400,000 small businesses across the country, and we’re building a workplace that represents and celebrates the customers we serve. Learn more about our Total Rewards philosophy. About the Role: We are seeking an experienced People Technology Integration Developer to design, build, and maintain integrations that power our People technology ecosystem. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to develop scalable solutions between Workday and a wide range of internal and external systems, with a strong focus on MuleSoft/Workday orchestrate as the enterprise integration platform. The ideal candidate is both a hands-on developer and a problem solver—someone who thrives in complex data environments, understands HR business processes, and can translate requirements into reliable, high-performing integration workflows. About the Team: The People Solutions team is transforming how Gusto supports its people by pairing cutting-edge AI with smart automation. We optimize workflows, enhance service delivery, and free up teams to focus on meaningful, high-impact work to support a more responsive, efficient, and future-ready people experience. Here’s what you’ll do day-to-day: Integration Development & Architecture Design, build, test, and maintain Workday integrations including EIBs, Core Connectors, and calculated fields leveraging Mulesoft and/or Workday orchestrate. Architect integration solutions that adhere to enterprise integration standards, security practices, and scalability requirements with an AI first mindset. Systems & Data Management Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across HR platforms and downstream systems. Troubleshoot integration failures, identify root causes, and proactively implement corrective actions. Partner with security teams to ensure proper data governance, access controls, and encryption. Collaboration & Stakeholder Partnership Work with Workday developers within the People Tech team as well as cross functional partners to gather integration requirements and translate them into technical designs. Document integration specifications, data mappings, workflows, and system configurations. Participate in Workday release planning and regression testing to ensure integrations remain stable. Continuous Improvement Monitor integration performance, optimize workflows, and identify opportunities to increase automation. Recommend and implement best practices for integration lifecycle management, versioning, and CI/CD within MuleSoft. Stay current with Workday and MuleSoft roadmap updates, new features, and industry trends. Here’s what we're looking for: Required 5+ years of experience developing integrations for Workday HCM. Strong hands-on experience with MuleSoft Anypoint Platform, including API design, flows, connectors, and error handling. Deep understanding of HRIS data structures, HR processes, and secure data integrations. Proficiency with XML, XSLT, JSON, REST, SOAP, and related integration technologies. Experience with Workday integration tools: EIBs, Studio, Core Connectors, PECI, and Report-as-a-Service (RaaS). Orchestrate experience preferred Strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving abilities. Preferred MuleSoft Developer certification(s) (MCD-Level 1/2). Workday Pro certification(s) in Integrations or relevant HCM domains. Greenhouse experience preferred Experience with API-led architecture and CI/CD pipelines. Experience integrating HR platforms with payroll, benefits, identity management, and finance systems. Background with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) and monitoring tools. Our cash compensation amount for this role is between $188,085 - $231,972/year in Denver, between $221,275 - $272,906/year for New York/San Francisco. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate location, experience and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed above. Gusto has physical office spaces in Denver, San Francisco, and New York City. Employees who are based in those locations will be expected to work from the office on designated days approximately 2-3 days per week (or more depending on role). The same office expectations apply to all Symmetry roles, Gusto's subsidiary, whose physical office is in Scottsdale. Note: The San Francisco office expectations encompass both the San Francisco and San Jose metro areas. When approved to work from a location other than a Gusto office, a secure, reliable, and consistent internet connection is required. This includes non-office days for hybrid employees. Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto. Gusto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Gusto considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Gusto is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. We want to see our candidates perform to the best of their ability. If you require a medical or religious accommodation at any time throughout your candidate journey, please fill out this form and a member of our team will get in touch with you. Gusto takes security and protection of your personal information very seriously. Please review our Fraudulent Activity Disclaimer. Personal information collected and processed as part of your Gusto application will be subject to Gusto's Applicant Privacy Notice.
requirements: 5+ years of experience developing integrations for Workday HCM.
Strong hands-on experience with MuleSoft Anypoint Platform, including API design, flows, connectors, and error handling.
Experience with Workday integration tools: EIBs, Studio, Core Connectors, PECI, and Report-as-a-Service (RaaS). Orchestrate experience preferred
Workday Pro certification(s) in Integrations or relevant HCM domains. Greenhouse experience preferred
Experience with API-led architecture and CI/CD pipelines.
Experience integrating HR platforms with payroll, benefits, identity management, and finance systems.
